NAME: Al-Abrar Mosque
DESCRIPTIO: Located on Telok Ayer Street, a short walk from Thian Hock Keng, the Former Keng Teck Whay Building, and the Former Nagore Dargah, Al-Abrar Mosque is one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest mosques.

NAME: Abdul Gafoor Mosque
DESCRIPTIO: Abdul Gafoor Mosque's charming architecture stands out amidst the surrounding shophouses in the historic Little India district.

NAME: Former Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus Chapel and Caldwell House (now CHIJMES)
DESCRIPTIO: Owing to its central location, the Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus was also affectionately referred to as the Town Convent in the past.

NAME: Yueh Hai Ching Temple
DESCRIPTIO: Dwarfed by modern skyscrapers in the heart of the Central Business District is one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest Chinese temples, Yueh Hai Ching Temple.

NAME: St Joseph's Church
DESCRIPTIO: Saint Josephâ€™s Church on Victoria Street was the headquarters of the Portuguese Mission in Singapore.

NAME: St. George's Church
DESCRIPTIO: Saint Georgeâ€™s Church is situated in the quiet environs off Minden Road, a short distance from the bustling shopping district of Orchard Road.

NAME: Church of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary
DESCRIPTIO: The Church of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary is one of the earliest Catholic churches built in the suburbs of Singapore.

NAME: Former Nanyang University Library and Administration Building, Memorial and Arch
DESCRIPTIO: Nanyang University, affectionately known as Nantah, was the first Chinese-language university in Southeast Asia and the second university in Singapore.

NAME: Former Attorney-Generals Chambers (now Parliament House Block C)
DESCRIPTIO: Tucked away in a corner near the Padang is a beautiful structure that once housed the Attorney-General's Chambers.

NAME: Former Raffles College (now NUS Campus at Bukit Timah)
DESCRIPTIO: Located next to the Singapore Botanic Gardens, the Former Raffles College is well hidden from the public eye.

NAME: Former Ford Factory (now Memories at Old Ford Factory)
DESCRIPTIO: Built atop a little hill, the Former Ford Factory has been a visual landmark in Bukit Timah since its completion in 1941.

NAME: Jurong Town Hall
DESCRIPTIO: On a hill overlooking Jurong estate, Jurong Town Hall once served as the headquarters of Jurong Town Corporation (JTC, presently JTC Corporation).

NAME: Alkaff Upper Serangoon Mosque
DESCRIPTIO: Alkaff Upper Serangoon Mosque was constructed by the mercantile and landowning Alkaff family to serve the spiritual needs of the local Muslim community at large.

NAME: Sri Thendayuthapani Temple
DESCRIPTIO: Sri Thendayuthapani Temple, commonly referred to as the Chettiarsâ€™ Temple, is one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest Hindu temples dedicated to Murugan, the Hindu deity who is also known as Sri Thendayuthapani.

NAME: Cathedral of the Good Shepherd
DESCRIPTIO: The Cathedral of the Good Shepherd is Singapore's oldest Catholic place of worship and the seat of the local Roman Catholic archbishop.

NAME: Thian Hock Keng
DESCRIPTIO: Thian Hock Keng (â€˜Palace of Heavenly Happinessâ€™) is one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest Hokkien temples.

NAME: Sri Perumal Temple
DESCRIPTIO: Formerly known as Sri Narasimha Perumal Temple, Sri Srinivasa Perumal Temple is the first Hindu temple in Singapore dedicated to Sri Perumal, the Hindu deity more commonly known as Vishnu.

NAME: Sri Mariamman Temple
DESCRIPTIO: Together with Jamae Mosque, Sri Mariamman Temple â€“ Singaporeâ€™s oldest Hindu temple â€“ is an enduring icon on South Bridge Road which is a part of Chinatown.

NAME: Former Ministry of Labour Building (now Family Justice Courts)
DESCRIPTIO: The Former Ministry of Labour Building is located not far away from the Former Thong Chai Medical Institution and Tan Si Chong Su.

NAME: Former Supreme Court
DESCRIPTIO: Amidst the colonial buildings and skyscrapers of the Civic District rises the copper-green dome of the Former Supreme Court.

NAME: Former Telok Ayer Market (now known as Lau Pa Sat)
DESCRIPTIO: Affectionately known as Lau Pa Sat (â€˜Old Marketâ€™) by generations of Singaporeans, the Former Telok Ayer Market was one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest markets.

NAME: The Istana and Sri Temasek
DESCRIPTIO: Shielded from the bustling Orchard Road by a sprawling green lung, the Istana (â€˜Palaceâ€™ in Malay) is the official residence of the President of the Republic of Singapore.

NAME: Former Siong Lim Temple (now Lian Shan Shuang Lin Monastery)
DESCRIPTIO: The traditional architecture of Lian Shan Shuang Lin Monastery â€“ or â€˜Twin Grove Monastery on Lotus Hillâ€™ â€“ stands out amidst the modern high-rise apartment blocks in the Toa Payoh neighbourhood.

NAME: MacDonald House
DESCRIPTIO: Located not far from the Istana and the Former Cathay Building, MacDonald House has a relatively plain and unadorned faÃ§ade that does not appear to be exceptionally striking.

NAME: Jamae Mosque
DESCRIPTIO: Like the nearby Sri Mariamman Temple, Jamae Mosque has been a familiar landmark on South Bridge Road since the mid-nineteenth century.

NAME: Former Admiralty House
DESCRIPTIO: Surrounded by several ancillary buildings and facilities on a sprawling estate, the Former Admiralty House used to accommodate key military commanders based in Singapore.

NAME: Church of Our Lady of Lourdes
DESCRIPTIO: Known simply as the Indian Church or Tamil Church in the past, the Church of Our Lady of Lourdes is one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest Catholic churches.

NAME: Singapore River Bridges: Cavenagh Bridge, Anderson Bridge and Elgin Bridge
DESCRIPTIO: Cavenagh, Anderson and Elgin Bridges are the three most historic and architecturally impressive bridges that span the Singapore River. Collectively, they illustrate Singapore's growth as a trading port and flourishing city. Located at the historic mouth

NAME: Former Sun Yat Sen Villa (now Sun Yat Sen Nanyang Memorial Hall)
DESCRIPTIO: Sun Yat-sen Nanyang Memorial Hall is one of the few surviving examples of villas that were once common sights in British Singapore.

NAME: National Museum of Singapore
DESCRIPTIO: With its wide faÃ§ade and large dome, the National Museum of Singapore has been a prominent landmark on Stamford Road for over a century.

NAME: Raffles Hotel
DESCRIPTIO: Raffles Hotel is one of the most well-known luxury hotels in Singapore and the oldest surviving establishment of its kind on the island.

NAME: Former Parliament House and Annex Building (now The Arts House)
DESCRIPTIO: The Former Parliament House is likely to be the oldest surviving building in Singapore.

NAME: Former Hill Street Police Station
DESCRIPTIO: Nicknamed the â€˜Police Skyscraperâ€™ in the past, the Former Hill Street Police Station is prominently located at the junction of Hill Street and River Valley Road.

NAME: Chung Cheng High School (Main) Administration Building and Entrance Arch
DESCRIPTIO: As one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest Chinese high schools, Chung Cheng High School was among the firsts to make higher education accessible to Chinese youth.

NAME: Civilian War Memorial
DESCRIPTIO: Not far from the Esplanade Park Memorials stands the Civilian War Memorial, the first memorial in Singapore dedicated to the civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation (1942â€“1945).

NAME: Former Tanjong Pagar Railway Station
DESCRIPTIO: The Former Tanjong Pagar Railway Station was previously the southernmost terminal station of the Federated Malay States Railways.

NAME: Esplanade Park Memorials
DESCRIPTIO: Prior to the first land reclamation in 1843, the original shoreline of Singapore ran across the present Padang.

NAME: Former Command House
DESCRIPTIO: The stately Former Command House is located near Bukit Timah Road, a major road constructed during the mid-nineteenth century and one of the last defences against the invading Japanese troops in 1942.

NAME: Former St James Power Station
DESCRIPTIO: The Former Saint James Power Station was the first coal-fired power station on the island.

NAME: Church of St Teresa
DESCRIPTIO: Standing atop a little hill, the Church of Saint Teresa was originally constructed for the spiritual needs of the Hokkien-speaking Catholics living in the town area.

NAME: Bowyer Block
DESCRIPTIO: Amidst the modern blocks in the sprawling compound of Singapore General Hospital stands a Neoclassical building with its distinctive clock tower.

NAME: Former Keng Teck Whay Building
DESCRIPTIO: Once home to one of Singapore's oldest self-help organisations, the Former Keng Teck Whay Building is situated next to Thian Hock Keng.

NAME: Telok Ayer Chinese Methodist Church
DESCRIPTIO: Originally known as the Chinese Methodist Church, Telok Ayer Chinese Methodist Church was the first church established to cater exclusively to the spiritual needs of the Chinese Methodist community.

NAME: Prinsep Street Presbyterian Church
DESCRIPTIO: Prinsep Street Presbyterian Church is one of Singaporeâ€™s oldest Presbyterian churches.

NAME: Former Nagore Dargah
DESCRIPTIO: The Former Nagore Dargah is situated on the historic Telok Ayer Street, a short distance from Telok Ayer Chinese Methodist Church, Al-Abrar Mosque and Thian Hock Keng.

NAME: Former Tao Nan School (now The Peranakan Museum)
DESCRIPTIO: A stoneâ€™s throw from the Armenian Church is a century-old building that used to house Tao Nan School, the first modern Chinese school in Singapore.

NAME: Hong San See
DESCRIPTIO: Hong San See (â€˜Temple on Phoenix Hillâ€™), perched on the side of Institution Hill off Mohamed Sultan Road, was established by Hokkien immigrants from Nanâ€™an (or Lam Ann) County in Fujian Province.

NAME: Former House of Tan Yeok Nee
DESCRIPTIO: Standing out prominently from its modern surroundings, the Chinese-style Former House of Tan Yeok Nee is the sole survivor of the â€˜Four Grand Mansionsâ€™ built in the late nineteenth-century.

NAME: Central Fire Station
DESCRIPTIO: The Central Fire Station is the oldest surviving fire station in Singapore and is a living monument to the local firefighting force.

NAME: Maghain Aboth Synagogue
DESCRIPTIO: Located in the former Jewish neighbourhood, Maghain Aboth Synagogue is the oldest surviving synagogue not only in Singapore, but also in Southeast Asia.

NAME: Former Saint Joseph's Institution (now Singapore Art Museum)
DESCRIPTIO: Saint Joseph's Institution is the oldest Catholic boys' school in Singapore and was founded by the Christian Brothers (formally known as the Institute of the Brothers of the Christian Schools)

NAME: Changi Prison Gate Wall and Turrets
DESCRIPTIO: Changi Prison was designed to be a maximum security prison to house up to 600 criminals sentenced to long-term imprisonment in British Singapore.

NAME: Former Singapore Conference Hall and Trade Union House (now Singapore Conference Hall)
DESCRIPTIO: The Former Singapore Conference Hall and Trade Union House was constructed to house the headquarters of the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) as the fulfilment of an election promise.

NAME: Tou Mu Kung Temple
DESCRIPTIO: Tou Mu Kung Temple is the oldest temple in Singapore dedicated to the Taoist deity Jiu Huang Ye (â€˜Nine Emperorsâ€™ or â€˜Ninth Emperorâ€™).

NAME: Former Thong Chai Medical Institution
DESCRIPTIO: Home to the first free traditional Chinese medical clinic for the poor in Singapore, the Former Thong Chai Medical Institution testifies to the Chinese pioneersâ€™ spirit of mutual assistance and their generosity towards the poor and needy.

NAME: Former Cathay Building (now The Cathay)
DESCRIPTIO: The Art Deco faÃ§ade wall fronting the modern glass architecture of The Cathay is the remnant of what used to be Malayaâ€™s tallest building.

NAME: Tan Teck Guan Building
DESCRIPTIO: Standing beside the College of Medicine Building is a smaller, two-storey building known as Tan Teck Guan Building.

NAME: Armenian Apostolic Church of Saint Gregory the Illuminator
DESCRIPTIO: The Armenian Apostolic Church of Saint Gregory the Illuminator â€“ commonly called the Armenian Church â€“ is Singapore's oldest Christian church

NAME: Ying Fo Fui Kun
DESCRIPTIO: Not far from Former Nagore Dargah on Telok Ayer Street is Ying Fo Fui Kun, Singaporeâ€™s oldest Hakka clan association.

NAME: Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall
DESCRIPTIO: In the heart of Singaporeâ€™s historic Civic District stand the magnificent Victoria Theatre and Victoria Concert Hall with the iconic clock tower.

NAME: Goodwood Park Hotel (Tower Block)
DESCRIPTIO: The Tower Wing of the present-day Goodwood Park Hotel was home to the German Teutonia Club, one of the earliest European national clubs in Singapore.

NAME: Former Empress Place Building (now Asian Civilisations Museum)
DESCRIPTIO: Situated at the mouth of the Singapore River, the Former Empress Place Building was an important government building in Singapore up to the 1980s.

NAME: Former Fullerton Building
DESCRIPTIO: The former Fullerton Building is a prominent landmark situated at the mouth of the Singapore River.

NAME: Tan Si Chong Su
DESCRIPTIO: The history of Tan Si Chong Su (â€˜Ancestral Hall of the Tan Clanâ€™) is inextricably linked to the influx of Chinese immigrants into Singapore during the late nineteenth century.

NAME: St. Andrew's Cathedral
DESCRIPTIO: Saint Andrew's Cathedral is Singaporeâ€™s oldest surviving Anglican place of worship and is the seat of the Anglican bishop of Singapore.

NAME: Sultan Mosque
DESCRIPTIO: Formerly the royal mosque of the Sultan of Johor, Sultan Mosque represents the solidarity and unity of Muslims in Singapore.

NAME: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque
DESCRIPTIO: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque is one of the oldest mosques in Singapore, a rare example of one named after a woman.

NAME: College of Medicine Building
DESCRIPTIO: The College of Medicine Building is located at the rear of the Singapore General Hospitalâ€™s compound, next to Tan Teck Guan Building.

NAME: Former City Hall
DESCRIPTIO: Located in the heart of the Civic District, the Former City Hall served as an important government office in Singapore.

NAME: Chesed-El Synagogue
DESCRIPTIO: Chesed-El Synagogue on Oxley Rise is one of two synagogues in Singapore, the other being Maghain Aboth Synagogue on Waterloo Street.

NAME: Istana Kampong Gelam
DESCRIPTIO: Within the historic district of Kampong Gelam lies Istana Kampong Gelam ('Gelam Village Palace').

NAME: Chinese High School Clock Tower
DESCRIPTIO: The Chinese High School Clock Tower Building is the icon of the oldest Chinese-medium high school in Singapore and has been a visual landmark of Bukit Timah Road since its completion.

NAME: Church of Saints Peter and Paul
DESCRIPTIO: The Church of Saints Peter and Paul is one of the oldest Catholic churches in Singapore that catered to a predominantly Chinese congregation.
